Class Connect4Model

java.lang.Object
Connect4Model
public class Connect4Model extends Object
The Connect4Model class represents the model component in the MVC (Model-View-Controller) design pattern for the Connect4 game. It encapsulates the game's state, including the game board, the current player, and the logic for making moves, checking for a winner, and determining a draw.

This class maintains a 2D array to represent the game board where each cell can be empty, occupied by player 'R' (Red), or occupied by player 'Y' (Yellow). The class provides methods to initialize the game board, make moves, switch players, and check for game-ending conditions.

Student names and IDs:

MVC Design: MODEL

    • Connect4Model

      public Connect4Model()
      Constructs a new Connect4Model and initializes the game board and the starting player.

  • Method Details

    • initializeBoard

      void initializeBoard()
      Initializes the game board to an empty state, with each cell set to '.'.

    • makeMove

      public boolean makeMove(int column)
      Attempts to make a move for the current player at the specified column. If the move is successful, the game board is updated and the method returns true. If the move cannot be made (e.g., the column is full or invalid), the method returns false.
      Parameters:
      column - the column where the move is to be made
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false otherwise

    • isDraw

      public boolean isDraw()
      Checks if the game has ended in a draw. A draw occurs when there are no empty cells left on the game board without any player winning.
      Returns:
      true if the game is a draw, false otherwise

    • checkWinner

      public boolean checkWinner()
      Checks if the current player has won the game. This method checks for 4 consecutive markers of the current player horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.
      Returns:
      true if the current player has won, false otherwise

    • switchPlayer

      public void switchPlayer()
      Switches the turn to the next player.

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard()
      Prints the current state of the game board to the console. This method is primarily for debugging purposes.

    • findNextRow

      int findNextRow(int column)
      Finds the next available row in the specified column that can be occupied by a player's move. If the column is full, this method returns -1.
      Parameters:
      column - the column to check
      Returns:
      the index of the next available row, or -1 if the column is full

    • getBoardValue

      public char getBoardValue(int row, int column)
      Retrieves the value at the specified row and column on the game board.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index
      column - the column index
      Returns:
      the character value at the specified location on the board

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public char getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the current player ('R' or 'Y').
      Returns:
      the current player

    • getColumns

      public static int getColumns()
      Returns:
      the columns

    • getRows

      public static int getRows()
      Returns:
      the rows
